abstract: A URL load request that is independent of protocol or URL scheme.
overview:
## Overview

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLRequest] encapsulates two essential properties of a load request: the URL to load and the policies used to load it. In addition, for HTTP and HTTPS requests, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLRequest] includes the HTTP method (`GET`, `POST`, and so on) and the HTTP headers.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLRequest] only represents information about the request. Use other classes, such as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLSession], to send the request to a server. See [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/fetching-website-data-into-memory] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/uploading-data-to-a-website] for an introduction to these techniques.

When writing Swift code, favor this structure over the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLRequest] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableURLRequest] classes.

Certain header fields are reserved; see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLRequest#Reserved-HTTP-headers].
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Foundation/URLRequest
crawled: 2025-12-03T09:51:17Z
---

# URLRequest

**Structure**

A URL load request that is independent of protocol or URL scheme.

## Declaration

```swift
struct URLRequest
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLRequest] encapsulates two essential properties of a load request: the URL to load and the policies used to load it. In addition, for HTTP and HTTPS requests, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLRequest] includes the HTTP method (`GET`, `POST`, and so on) and the HTTP headers.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLRequest] only represents information about the request. Use other classes, such as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLSession], to send the request to a server. See [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/fetching-website-data-into-memory] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/uploading-data-to-a-website] for an introduction to these techniques.

When writing Swift code, favor this structure over the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLRequest] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableURLRequest] classes.

Certain header fields are reserved; see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLRequest#Reserved-HTTP-headers].

## Creating a request

- **init(url:cachePolicy:timeoutInterval:)**: Creates and initializes a URL request with the given URL, cache policy, and timeout interval.

## Working with a cache policy

- **cachePolicy**: The request’s cache policy.
- **URLRequest.CachePolicy**: An alias for the cache policy.
- **NSURLRequest.CachePolicy**: The constants used to specify interaction with the cached responses.

## Accessing request components

- **httpMethod**: The HTTP request method.
- **url**: The URL of the request.
- **httpBody**: The data sent as the message body of a request, such as for an HTTP POST request.
- **httpBodyStream**: The stream used to deliver the HTTP body.
- **mainDocumentURL**: The main document URL associated with this request.

## Accessing header fields

- **allHTTPHeaderFields**: A dictionary containing all of the HTTP header fields for a request.
- **addValue(_:forHTTPHeaderField:)**: Adds a value to the header field.
- **setValue(_:forHTTPHeaderField:)**: Sets a value for the header field.
- **value(forHTTPHeaderField:)**: Retrieves a header value.

## Controlling request behavior

- **timeoutInterval**: The timeout interval of the request.
- **httpShouldHandleCookies**: A Boolean value indicating whether cookies will be sent with and set for this request.
- **httpShouldUsePipelining**: A Boolean value indicating whether the request should transmit before the previous response is received.
- **allowsCellularAccess**: A Boolean value indicating whether the request is allowed to use the built-in cellular radios to satisfy the request.
- **allowsPersistentDNS**
- **assumesHTTP3Capable**
- **cookiePartitionIdentifier**
- **requiresDNSSECValidation**

## Supporting limited modes

- **allowsConstrainedNetworkAccess**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the request may use the network when the user has specified Low Data Mode.
- **allowsExpensiveNetworkAccess**: A Boolean value that indicates whether connections may use a network interface that the system considers expensive.

## Accessing the service type

- **networkServiceType**: The type of network service for all tasks within network sessions to enable Cellular Network Slicing.
- **URLRequest.NetworkServiceType**: An alias for the network service type.
- **NSURLRequest.NetworkServiceType**: Constants that specify how a request uses network resources.

## Indicating the source of the request

- **attribution**: The entity that initiates the network request.
- **URLRequest.Attribution**: A type that indicates the entities that can make a network request.

## Using reference types

- **NSURLRequest**: A URL load request that is independent of protocol or URL scheme.
- **NSMutableURLRequest**: A mutable URL load request that is independent of protocol or URL scheme.
- **MutableURLRequest**

## Instance Properties

- **allowsUltraConstrainedNetworkAccess**: `true` if the receiver is allowed to use an interface marked as ultra-constrained to satify the request, `false` otherwise.

## Requests and responses

- **NSURLRequest**: A URL load request that is independent of protocol or URL scheme.
- **NSMutableURLRequest**: A mutable URL load request that is independent of protocol or URL scheme.
- **URLResponse**: The metadata associated with the response to a URL load request, independent of protocol and URL scheme.
- **HTTPURLResponse**: The metadata associated with the response to an HTTP protocol URL load request.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- ReferenceConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
